alert.note: Alert for Glasscock; Howard; Mitchell; Reagan; Scurry; Upton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued February 16 at 10:15PM CST until February 16 at 11:00PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Glasscock County in western Texas... Scurry County in western Texas... Mitchell County in western Texas... Reagan County in western Texas... Eastern Howard County in western Texas... Eastern Upton County in western Texas... * Until 1100 PM CST. * At 1014 PM CST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of J B Thomas Reservoir to 16 miles southeast of Greenwood to 8 miles north of McCamey, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 176 and 225. Locations impacted include... Big Spring, Snyder, Colorado City, Big Lake, McCamey, Rankin, Garden City, Coahoma, Loraine, Forsan, Sand Springs, Lake Colorado City, Lake Colorado City State Park, Inadale, Fluvanna, Colorado City Airport, J B Thomas Reservoir, Reagan County Airport, Champion Creek Reservoir and Westbrook. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.

area.areaDesc: Glasscock; Howard; Mitchell; Reagan; Scurry; Upton
